title: Networks Fast and Slow
description: Understanding how networks transform over time through interactive visualization.

steps.text: The network begins with scattered nodes, each representing individual entities in their original positions.
As connections form, the entire network shifts eastward, representing the geographic spread of influence.
The network stretches horizontally as new nodes join, creating wider connectivity patterns.
A major disruption causes the network to flip and compress, representing a paradigm shift in connections.
The network returns to center but grows larger, showing maturity and expanded influence.
